intro: Helicia youngiana var. robusta, commonly known as the robust helicia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
